_metadata.data_source: Nuvalent Overview January 12, 2026; Drilon et al ESMO 2024

biology.function: ALK (anaplastic lymphoma kinase) is a receptor tyrosine kinase that when fused to various partner genes (e.g., EML4-ALK) creates oncogenic fusion proteins driving tumor growth through constitutive kinase activation
biology.prevalence: ~3-5% of NSCLC; majority diagnosed at advanced/metastatic stage
biology.patient_demographics: Often younger patients; significant impact on quality of life

cns_involvement.overall: ~50% develop brain metastases over disease course

genetic_validation.oncogenic_driver: Yes - ALK fusions are validated oncogenic drivers in NSCLC, ALCL, and IMT
genetic_validation.predictive_biomarker: ALK fusion status by FISH, IHC, or NGS
genetic_validation.therapeutic_precedent: Multiple approved ALK TKIs (crizotinib, ceritinib, alectinib, brigatinib, lorlatinib, ensartinib)

rationale: Validated oncogenic driver with proven therapeutic tractability
Next-gen TKIs transforming durability expectations (lorlatinib 1L mPFS not reached at 60 months)
Younger patient population with potential for chronic disease management
Current best therapies (lorlatinib) have TRK-related CNS toxicities limiting tolerability
unmet_need: No approved therapy active after sequential 2G→3G TKIs
TRK-related CNS adverse events in >50% of lorlatinib patients
38% of lorlatinib patients no longer on therapy by 24 months in 1L

mechanism.binding_mode: ATP-competitive kinase inhibitor designed to fit the ALK kinase domain including mutant forms while avoiding TRK binding

selectivity_profile.alk_vs_trkb: >20x selectivity for ALK over TRKB across single and compound mutants
selectivity_profile.comparison_to_lorlatinib: Lorlatinib is a dual TRK/ALK inhibitor with minimal selectivity

in_vitro_activity.range: IC50 = 0.1-30 nM against ALK-driven cell lines
in_vitro_activity.coverage: Potent activity against single and compound ALK mutants including G1202R combinations

in_vivo_activity.description: Tumor regression at well-tolerated doses in ALK models including single and compound mutants

brain_penetration.comparison: Similar to preclinical observations for lorlatinib

alkove_1.registration_intent: Yes, for TKI pre-treated ALK+ NSCLC

alkazar.design: Phase 3 randomized controlled trial vs alectinib
alkazar.sites: ~160 sites across North America, Europe, Asia, Latin America

enrollment_trajectory.milestone: Phase 1+2 (transitioned to EAP for adult TKI pre-treated)

pivotal_safety.description: ALK+ NSCLC treated at RP2D as of August 29, 2025

tki_pretreated_efficacy.description: Treated at RP2D by September 30, 2024 to allow ≥6 months DOR follow-up
tki_pretreated_efficacy.note: Includes 25 patients with other oncogenic drivers in addition to ALK

tki_naive_preliminary.note: No patients with other oncogenic drivers in addition to ALK

efficacy_1_prior_2g_only.description: 1 prior 2G ALK TKI (alectinib n=44 or brigatinib n=2) ± chemo

efficacy_compound_mutations.description: ≥2 prior ALK TKIs with compound mutations

measurable_cns_lesions_any_prior_tki.ic_cr: 13% (12/92, includes 1 unconfirmed CR with prior confirmed PR)

measurable_cns_lesions_lorlatinib_naive.ic_cr: 21% (5/24, includes 1 unconfirmed CR with prior confirmed PR)

efficacy.orr: 86% (38/44, 4 CRs, includes 2 unconfirmed PR and 1 unconfirmed CR with prior confirmed PR)

intracranial_activity.ic_orr: 78% (7/9, 4 IC-CRs, includes 1 unconfirmed CR with prior confirmed PR)

tki_naive_results_alkove1_exploratory.note: Global enrollment of TKI-naïve patients ongoing in ALKAZAR Phase 3

dose_reduction_reasons_1_percent_or_more: AST increased (8%, not mutually exclusive - 11% for any transaminase)

transaminase_management.observation: Most were asymptomatic lab abnormalities, low-grade, transient, and reversible with dose interruptions or reductions
transaminase_management.preliminary_trend: Increased incidence in less heavily pre-treated patients
transaminase_management.mitigation: Enhanced monitoring and prompt dose interventions implemented in ALKAZAR Phase 3 protocol

safety.key_safety_message: Generally well-tolerated, consistent with ALK-selective, TRK-sparing design; no TRK-related neurotoxicities observed

alk_solid_tumors_beyond_nsclc.enrollment: Ongoing in Phase 2 portion of ALKOVE-1

preliminary_data.note: Durable responses observed including intracranial CR in patient who received prior alectinib

investment_analysis.stage_value: Late-stage Phase 2 (pivotal data); Phase 3 ongoing vs alectinib
investment_analysis.competitive_position: Potentially best-in-class for tolerability; durable activity in lorlatinib-experienced patients
investment_analysis.data_quality: High - pivotal data from global Phase 1/2 with BICR
investment_analysis.regulatory_pathway: NDA submission planned 1H 2026 for TKI pre-treated

commercial_potential.addressable_market: ~3-5% of NSCLC; US peak sales opportunity $1.35B-2.0B
key_commercial_factors: Only option active after sequential 2G→3G TKIs
TRK-sparing design addresses major lorlatinib limitation
ALKAZAR superiority vs alectinib would transform 1L landscape

key_data_to_watch: ALKAZAR Phase 3 enrollment and data readout
ALK+ solid tumors beyond NSCLC development

catalysts.event: NDA submission for TKI pre-treated ALK+ NSCLC
catalysts.significance: Regulatory filing for second approval pathway
Progress toward 1L head-to-head vs alectinib readout

catalysts.event: Continued enrollment for ALK+ solid tumors and adolescent ALK+ NSCLC
